author: A_Brickset_user
title: Supplementation
review: Instead of saving my money for a couple more weeks and buying a very dusty Lego 912 (the last one in the store!), I blew it on the 8030 in the spring of 1983.  It is a nice little set, just what you'd want if you were sick in bed and didn't feel like building anything in particular.  It (and the 8040 and 8050) are basically supplementary sets; kind of like the 8710 parts repository, just with a few more pieces and instructions.  The 8030 is nothing earthshattering, as you can get all the parts elsewhere, but it's a nice source for extra parts (those that might be missing from other sets).  Obviously I'd much rather have the 912.  6/10.  25 April 2004

author: davidmackenzie
title: The good old days!
review: Those were the days when you could build five models from one set! My brother and I spent ages playing with the little jeep. The large six-wheeled truck was another favourite. A great supplementary parts selection and five cool models.

author: BigLegoKid
title: Nice set of parts and models
review:
I got this set back in the 80's along with 8020 and shortly after that 8040. This set added a lot of general parts to my collection that helped me create a great many things. 

In particular the 6 wheeler was my favorite model to build nad play with. I built the windmill only once as it was not all that interesting or very playable. The jeep was he most playable but I am not sure why they did not put one of the extra ties on the back to aid in steering it. I added one of them to help and jeeps normally mount the spare back there so doing ti like that was more realistic.
